messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º   Uº R???
messages.msgSnippet: yaaaaaa knowwwwwww, if this HOT weather doesn t break SOON, I just MIGHT have to resort to doing a  *RAIN DANCE* or something!!!  ughhhhhhh, my weatherbug
messages.messageBody:
yaaaaaa knowwwwwww, if this HOT weather doesn't break SOON, I just MIGHT
have to resort to doing a *RAIN DANCE* or something!!! ughhhhhhh, my
weatherbug reached 114*, of course that's NOT official SA airport but it is
for OUR area ::::::::::::::::::

Pris ~> who'z sweating bullets in the suburbs >:P
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...

From: "Ashling Ranch" <Ashling@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 11:50 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???


> Pris,
>
> Weatherbug from Llano said High today was supposed to be 105, but it
was
> revised to 106 last time I checked. However, it is already 108 - and only
> 11:50 AM - UGH !
> John

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º   Uº R???
messages.msgSnippet: Pris, Weatherbug from Llano said High today was supposed to be 105, but it was revised to 106 last time I checked.  However, it is already 108 - and only 11:50
messages.messageBody:
Pris,

Weatherbug from Llano said High today was supposed to be 105, but it was
revised to 106 last time I checked. However, it is already 108 - and only
11:50 AM - UGH !
John

>
>"his train" is uhhhhh the *choo-choo* kind of train ... haha, amusing only
>to myself ... dh doesn't like running Amtrac, don't ask me why, prob b/c
>trains are always LATE and he doesn't like complaints from people ... his
>territory is from Taylor/Hearne, TX (above Austin) and down to Laredo but
he
>usually only goes north from SA to Taylor/Hearne and his trains are freight
>trains; gravel, cars, tank trucks, etc... AND YES, the tracks are *usually*
>is need of repair ... he retires in 8 yrs, so maybe we'll move to CA after
>he retires, oops, nope, don't want to be that far from that grandbaby,
don't
>you know :} lol ...
>
>Pris ~> who'z such a *dreamer* ...
>WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
>have learned how to type ...
>

>> > >
>> > > Well, not to make it too terrible for ya, Pris, but we live in an
area
>> > that
>> > > has the average temp for the whole U.S. which means it runs about 67
>> > > degrees all year. We only vary by about 10 degrees in either
>direction
>> > and
>> > > only have about a dozen frost days a year. The little town "next
>door"
>> > has
>> > > the most growing days in a year for the whole country.
>> > >
>> > > However, we can usually drive down the road a bit (half hour to an
>> hour)
>> > > and be in some friendly (80 to 90's) heat in one direction and
serious
>> > heat
>> > > (90's and up) in the other. But, this year we didn't get the
>> "friendly"
>> > > heat to often on the river which was a disappointment to the kidlets.
>> > >
>> > > And going up the hill to the hotter temps was kinda limited as last
>> year
>> > we
>> > > lost 100,000 acres to a fire compliments of the parks boozos and one
>of
>> > > their controlled burns.
>> > >
>> > > Lynda
